snippet: The announcement by Christine C. Quinn, in response to a judge’s ruling on the department’s stop-and-frisk policy, drew criticism from one of her mayoral rivals.
abstract: New York City mayoral candidate Christine C Quinn, whose campaign has been damaged by perception that she is less critical of Police Department’s stop-and-frisk practices than her leading rival Bill de Blasio, says she will submit court papers to support a monitor for the police; announcement draws criticism from de Blasio, who argues Quinn's move is political stunt.

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber and Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The announcement by Christine C. Quinn, in response to a judge’s ruling on the department’s stop-and-frisk policy, drew criticism from one of her mayoral rivals.

headline.main: Quinn to File Court Papers Supporting a Police Monitor
headline.print_headline: Quinn to File Papers Supporting Police Monitor; Rival Calls Announcement a Stunt
